channel.title: [PI] Cache Downloader Problem
channel.description:
I need help with my autocache downloader. I am currently using the BrokenX source. I have renamed the cache, and changed the download link to my cache. And yes, I'm using dropbox. Here's how it downloads.
First it starts like this: [IMG]http://i1179.photobucket.com/albums/x382/Jamaal222/Capture1.png[/img] It downloads 100%. This is what happens next. [IMG]http://i1179.photobucket.com/albums/x382/Jamaal222/Capture2-1.png[/img] This also downloads 100%, then this happens. [IMG]http://i1179.photobucket.com/albums/x382/Jamaal222/Capture3-1.png[/img] This is what it says in my command prompt. [CODE]GhettoScape is loading.. GhettoScapeCache.zip 71004630 java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\GhettoScapeCache\GhettoScapeCache\cacheVersion 1.dat (The system cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at CacheDownloader.unzip(CacheDownloader.java:220) at CacheDownloader.unZip(CacheDownloader.java:177) at CacheDownloader.downloadCache(CacheDownloader.java:79) at client.startUp(client.java:8484) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5780) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\GhettoScapeCache\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The syste m cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(Unknown Source) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:78) at client.startUp(client.java:8485) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5780) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\GhettoScapeCache\GhettoScapeCache\cacheVersion 1.dat (The system cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at Update.unZipFile(Update.java:66) at Update.<init>(Update.java:29) at client.streamLoaderForName(client.java:4466) at client.startUp(client.java:8495) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5780) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) [/CODE] And this is what is inside the cache that downloads. [IMG]http://i1179.photobucket.com/albums/x382/Jamaal222/Capture4-1.png[/img] And this is what the real cache looks like. [IMG]http://i1179.photobucket.com/albums/x382/Jamaal222/Capture5-1.png[/img]
The server works when I manually insert the cache. It also works for my friend when he does the same. I have googled it, but I wasn't able to find any solutions. I found a guy that claims he fixed the problem, and I've messaged him, but he hasn't responded. Btw,this is a desktop client. Any help is appreciated. Thanks.

item.title: [PI] Cache Downloader Problem
item.dc:creator: @GrapeDrank GrapeDrank
item.description:
@GrapeDrank wrote:

Alright, I’ll try that.

EDIT: Back to square one. I zipped all the folders inside using these steps.

open ur cache folder ctrl+a right click Zip upload to dropbox copy public link enjoy.

I uploaded it, changed the link, and i’m back to where I started.

I openned up the cache that it downloaded, and I found the cache inside it zipped. I openned it and everything was inside that o_o. It wasn’t in the cache file itself though.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @mrdrzj mrdrzj
item.description:

nothing?
you just zip all the files inside the cache
and thats all?

Just right click the file save as and compressed zip folder

item.title: [PI] Cache Downloader Problem
item.dc:creator: @mrdrzj mrdrzj
item.description:
@mrdrzj wrote:

YOU NEED TO ZIP IT
do this
open ur cache folder
ctrl+a
right click
Zip
upload to dropbox
copy public link
enjoy.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Cache Downloader Problem
item.dc:creator: @GrapeDrank GrapeDrank
item.description:
@GrapeDrank wrote:

I can’t get a link for the folder. If I zip the folder, then I can get a link, but I was told not to do that.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Cache Downloader Problem
item.dc:creator: @mrdrzj mrdrzj
item.description:
@mrdrzj wrote:

when you upload the cache.zip to your public folder, then open ur public folder and if you are using dropbox via ISP then next to the name an option with an up sign something like this ^ and click copy public link
|
if you downloaded dropbox right click click the dropbox thing and click Copy Public Link

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Cache Downloader Problem
item.dc:creator: @GrapeDrank GrapeDrank
item.description:
@GrapeDrank wrote:

@merk u zerk
It does download to the c drive. It’s just half empty. And I have tried renaming it, but i have made modifications so I had to re-upload it. Same thing happened. Only part of it downloaded. I was told it wasn’t zipped properly, and I was told to zip the contents inside instead of the cache itself. Only problem with that is that there is no direct download link :/.

@mrdrzj
How do you get the public links for folders? It is in the public folder, but there is no option for that :/. The contents inside are zipped, but not the cache itself. I was told to do that o_o.

EDIT: I do have the links changed, although I don’t have a link for the cache that isn’t zipped, where the files inside are zipped.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Cache Downloader Problem
item.dc:creator: @merk_u_zerk merk u zerk
item.description:
@merk_u_zerk wrote:

Maybe its not working, Zip the folder, compressed zip file upload it and try. make sure in cache dler u change the links.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Cache Downloader Problem
item.dc:creator: @mrdrzj mrdrzj
item.description:
@mrdrzj wrote:

you can get public links
make sure you uploaded the cache in the public folder and then there is copy public link option

when you do that replace the cache downloader link with the copy public link one

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Cache Downloader Problem
item.dc:creator: @merk_u_zerk merk u zerk
item.description:
@merk_u_zerk wrote:

Also the client only responds to the original name of the cache so, Put the name back to its original name and try again. And another reason why is that the cache is not getting downloaded into the local disk c drive.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Cache Downloader Problem
item.dc:creator: @GrapeDrank GrapeDrank
item.description:
@GrapeDrank wrote:

Uhhh. If you’re asking if it extracts to the c drive, then the answer is a yes. The only problem is that some of the files are missing. I was told it isn’t zipped properly and zipped the files inside instead of the cache itself , but I can’t get a public link for a direct download.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Cache Downloader Problem
item.dc:creator: @GrapeDrank GrapeDrank
item.description:
@GrapeDrank wrote:

I need help with my autocache downloader. I am currently using the BrokenX source. I have renamed the cache, and changed the download link to my cache. And yes, I’m using dropbox. Here’s how it downloads.

First it starts like this:

Capture1.png764×504

It downloads 100%. This is what happens next.
Capture2-1.png766×503

This also downloads 100%, then this happens.
Capture3-1.png765×503

This is what it says in my command prompt.

GhettoScape is loading.. GhettoScapeCache.zip 71004630 java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\GhettoScapeCache\GhettoScapeCache\cacheVersion 1.dat (The system cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at CacheDownloader.unzip(CacheDownloader.java:220) at CacheDownloader.unZip(CacheDownloader.java:177) at CacheDownloader.downloadCache(CacheDownloader.java:79) at client.startUp(client.java:8484) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5780) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\GhettoScapeCache\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The syste m cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(Unknown Source) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:78) at client.startUp(client.java:8485) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5780) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\GhettoScapeCache\GhettoScapeCache\cacheVersion 1.dat (The system cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at Update.unZipFile(Update.java:66) at Update.<init>(Update.java:29) at client.streamLoaderForName(client.java:4466) at client.startUp(client.java:8495) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:5780) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
And this is what is inside the cache that downloads.

And this is what the real cache looks like.

The server works when I manually insert the cache. It also works for my friend when he does the same. I have googled it, but I wasn’t able to find any solutions. I found a guy that claims he fixed the problem, and I’ve messaged him, but he hasn’t responded. Btw,this is a desktop client. Any help is appreciated. Thanks.

Read full topic
